org.jWebSocket.api
Interface WebSocketEngine

All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseEngine
public interface WebSocketEngine

Specifies the API for jWebSocket engines. An engine maintains multiple connectors. The engine does neither parse nor process but data packets but only passes them from either an underlying connector to the above server(s) or from one of the higher level servers to one or more connectors of a particular engine.

Method Summary
 void addServer(WebSocketServer aServer)
          Registers a server at the engine so that the engine is able to notify the server in case of new connections and incoming data packets from a connector.
 void broadcastPacket(WebSocketPaket aDataPacket)
          Broadcasts a data packet to all connectors.
 void connectorStarted(WebSocketConnector aConnector)
          Is called after a new client has connected.
 void connectorStopped(WebSocketConnector aConnector)
          Is called after a new client has disconnected.
 void engineStarted()
          Is called after the web socket engine has been started sucessfully.
 void engineStopped()
          Is called after the web socket engine has (been) stopped sucessfully.
 java.util.List<WebSocketConnector> getConnectors()
          Returns the list of clients connected to this engine.
 java.util.List<WebSocketServer> getServers()
          Returns a list of all servers that are currenly bound to this engine.
 boolean isAlive()
          Returns true if the engine is running or false otherwise.
 void processPacket(WebSocketConnector aConnector, WebSocketPaket aDataPacket)
          Processes an incoming data packet from a certain connector.
 void removeConnector(WebSocketConnector aConnector)
          Removes a certain connector from the engine.
 void removeServer(WebSocketServer aServer)
          Unregisters a server from the engine so that the engine won't notify the server in case of new connections or incoming data packets from a connector.
 void sendPacket(WebSocketConnector aConnector, WebSocketPaket aDataPacket)
          Sends a data packet to a certain connector.
 void startEngine()
          Starts the engine.
 void stopEngine()
          Stops the engine.
 

Method Detail

startEngine

void startEngine()
                 throws WebSocketException
Starts the engine. Usually an engine is implemented as a thread which waits for new clients to be connected via a WebSocketConnector. So here usually the listener threads for incoming connections are instantiated.

Throws:
WebSocketException

stopEngine

void stopEngine()
                throws WebSocketException
Stops the engine. Here usually first all connected clients are stopped and afterwards the listener threads for incoming new clients is stopped as well.

Throws:
WebSocketException

engineStarted

void engineStarted()
Is called after the web socket engine has been started sucessfully. Here usually the engine notifies the server(s) above that the engine is started.

engineStopped

void engineStopped()
Is called after the web socket engine has (been) stopped sucessfully. Here usually the engine notifies the server(s) above that the engine has stopped.

connectorStarted

void connectorStarted(WebSocketConnector aConnector)
Is called after a new client has connected. Here usually the engine notifies the server(s) above that a new connection has been established.

Parameters:
aConnector -

connectorStopped

void connectorStopped(WebSocketConnector aConnector)
Is called after a new client has disconnected. Here usually the engine notifies the server(s) above that a connection has been closed.

Parameters:
aConnector -

getConnectors

java.util.List<WebSocketConnector> getConnectors()
Returns the list of clients connected to this engine. Please consider that a server can support multiple engines. This method only returns the clients of this engine.

Returns:
the connector clients

isAlive

boolean isAlive()
Returns true if the engine is running or false otherwise. The alive status usually represents the state of the main engine listener thread.

Returns:
true or false based on the server status

processPacket

void processPacket(WebSocketConnector aConnector,
                   WebSocketPaket aDataPacket)
Processes an incoming data packet from a certain connector. The implementation of the engine usually simply passes the packets to the server(s) of the overlying communication tier.

Parameters:
aConnector -
aDataPacket -

sendPacket

void sendPacket(WebSocketConnector aConnector,
                WebSocketPaket aDataPacket)
Sends a data packet to a certain connector.

Parameters:
aConnector -
aDataPacket -

broadcastPacket

void broadcastPacket(WebSocketPaket aDataPacket)
Broadcasts a data packet to all connectors. Usually the implementation simply iterates through the list of connectors and calls their sendPacket method.

Parameters:
aDataPacket -

removeConnector

void removeConnector(WebSocketConnector aConnector)
Removes a certain connector from the engine. This usually has not to be done by the application but by the engine implementations only.

Parameters:
aConnector -

getServers

java.util.List<WebSocketServer> getServers()
Returns a list of all servers that are currenly bound to this engine. This list of servers is maintained by the engine and should not be manipulated by the application.

Returns:

addServer

void addServer(WebSocketServer aServer)
Registers a server at the engine so that the engine is able to notify the server in case of new connections and incoming data packets from a connector. This method is not supposed to be called directly from the application.

Parameters:
aServer -

removeServer

void removeServer(WebSocketServer aServer)
Unregisters a server from the engine so that the engine won't notify the server in case of new connections or incoming data packets from a connector. This method is not supposed to be called directly from the application.

Parameters:
aServer -
